just upgraded hardware drivers for nvidi: any thoughts on how to roll back a driver?
or at least start xorg config from scratch?
Unless you deliberately written it, there is no xorg.conf on Ubuntu 11.10 by default.
My best guess would be to remove the associated package, then the driver should deactivate.
Or, alternatively, you can use 'lsmod' to list all activated driver modules, and then use 'sudo modprobe -r <module_name>' to remove that driver.
Use 'sudo modprobe' to add back modules if it won't help.
Hmm. Have you tried removing the package?
It looks to me, that version of the driver module in your kernel is different from the one you have installed, which produces the error you mentioned.
I have got that once, when the installation got interrupted.
I just re-installed it and things got back to green zone.
